posts.author: nrgsille
posts.post_text: August 19, 2019 at 7:43 PM#2Hello there,it is possible to set the color via cmd, but it will not work like appearance.Syntax is defined like following:Assign root livesetup.layers.*layernumber*.*fixture*.*subfixture* /color=*max16777216*The colors are calculated differently, it is the result of 256x256x256 so the max value is 16777216. The value to set the color to red would be just 255, but for cyan it is 16776960. Every time you get over 256, the next color will add 1 value and red begins again with the next 256 steps.The syntax for cyan would look likeCodeAssign root livesetup.layers.3.1.1 /color=16776960A few examples:red=255green=65280yellow=65535blue=16711680cyan=16776960Visit my website to get nice 3D fixture profiles for grandMA2 and dot2NRGSille Lighting Design

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: August 21, 2019 at 1:59 PM#3Don't need to go through the root - you can just assign it to the Fixture or Channel directly:Assign Fixture x /color=yAssign Channel x /color=yHere's the math for y:y = (Red Value) + (Green Value * 256) + (Blue Value * 65536)For example, R/G/B = 50/180/222y = (50) + (180 * 256) + (222 * 65536)y = 50 + 46,080 + 14,548,992y = 14,595,122Assign Fixture x /color=14595122
